td.h2: Continuation of the Stay at Home Order
td.div: We have received a couple of messages requesting information about the end of the year procedures due to the use of remote learning through the end of the school year. Although final plans have not been completed, our remote learning days will conclude on May 20th, 2020. We will use May 21 and 22 to have a systematic way to collect items from students lockers, cubbies, and desks while also turning in Chromebooks and I-Pads, charging blocks, books, and good bye notes to their teachers. Currently, we are planning to hold a virtual graduation for our 8th grade students on May 14th, details will be forthcoming next week with more information about the end of the year and the graduation ceremonies posted on the website.
td.h2: 2020-2021 Principal Announcement - Joint Letter Click Here
td.div: ​Oak Grove teachers and staff will use Monday, April 20th as a Remote Learning Planning Day (RLPD) as identified in the Oak Grove Remote Learning Plan to plan for the upcoming lessons associated with April 20-24 and April 27-30. Students may have assigned activities to complete but the teacher will not be expected to hold face to face meetings or check in as they will use the time to create and organize for the upcoming lessons. Regular remote learning will begin once again on Tuesday, April 21st. Look for notifications from your student's teachers about specific pick-up of informational packets if applicable. Once again, if you need meals this week, you must fill out the form OAK GROVE MEALS ORDER FORM on the Oak Grove website by 9:30 am on Monday mornings in order to receive your weekly meals for pick up or delivery between 10 am and 11 am.
td.h2: 4.17.2020 - Remote Learning Extended - Letter from Dr. Baele
How to get meals for our remote learning days...
td.div: Free and Reduced qualified families can order lunch and breakfast items for the week by filling out the form here and each week thereafter. Just click on the OAK GROVE MEALS ORDER FORM and complete the necessary information. We are not currently serving to those that have not already classified as Free or Reduced Lunch qualified. Meals will be prepared on Monday morning by Oak Grove staff for pick up or delivery by 11 am on that Monday. We plan to do this as long as we are under the Governor's "Stay at Home" order. If you should have any questions, please email lbaele@og68.org.

font.a: View the Oak Grove Remote Learning Plan - Click Here

td.h2: 3.20.2020 - Stay at Home Order - Oak Grove School Closed
td.div:
The Oak Grove School and District offices will be closed on March 20, 2020 until April 30th, 2020. If you should have a question or request please contact Dr. Baele via email at lbaele@og68.org. Construction operations are considered essential workers so you will continue to see activity at Oak Grove School. Also, there will be no learning activities next week during our regularly scheduled Spring Break (March 23 - 27). Look for more information regarding how learning will be classified by the Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) for the days after Spring Break. Monday, March 30th is an "Act of God" day but March 31st through April 30th will be considered "remote learning days". This means that students must participate in activities or risk the classification of an incomplete grade if not completing any work. We will keep you informed as we know more information until then, I hope that you all are safe and do their best to protect their families and our students from COVID-19 in the weeks to come.
Letter from Dr. Baele regarding the Executive Order - Stay at Home order.
Latest Press Release - Peoria County Health Department
State Website on COVID-19

Thank you parents for your calls and your questions regarding your students continued education. If you should continue to have any issues or problems, teachers are available between the hours of 9 am to 2:30 pm to facilitate learning through this Friday and again on Monday, March 30th. If you should have any questions regarding grades or issues with student participation, please call me in the office. Also, any families that are classified as free or reduced lunches will be provided lunch and breakfast items for pick up, please contact the office at 309.697.0621 to get that set up with the cafeteria staff. In the event that the Governor's directive would be extended, teachers will provide additional learning activities for their students and we will develop a pick-up process for new material. Entry into the building is Door 1, the main entrance at the school. Thank you for your patience as we continue to navigate uncharted waters.

ul.h2: Submit your questions to Dr. Baele about Covid-19.
ul.label: * Indicates required field

td.h2: District Q & A on Coronavirus - www.og68.org/covid19

div.font: Oak Grove School District would like to provide families with the latest information regarding the spread of infectious diseases, especially Influenza ​and the emerging coronavirus. The most important thing that you can do as parents is to monitor your child's health and temperature. If your child has a fever, it is important to keep them home from school, the District appreciates your cooperation regarding the 24 hour fever free policy. Additional steps to combat infectious disease include; washing hands with hot, soapy water for at least 20 seconds and drying them thoroughly, wiping down all frequently used surfaces and areas within your home, and avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands. Below are links to important documents and webpages regarding letters and information for your review. We hope to keep you as informed as we can regarding the public health and welfare of our Oak Grove students and families.

td.div: The current construction projects at Oak Grove School include the addition on the back of the Heath Gymnasium which will hold a Bright Futures / ECE classroom, a future classroom that will be used for gym storage and custodial storage, the new PE teacher's office and storage area, as well as two changing rooms that may be needed for basketball and volleyball games. Additionally, the old locker room areas will be converted into a Nurse's office, two additional offices, a dedicated copy room, classroom storage, PTO / Booster storage, and district file storage. On the exterior, the existing playground is being extended, the pickup line is also being extended, and blacktop is being placed for recess on damp days and for baseball / softball game parking. Richard Wagner fields are being rebuilt in a different configuration to better support the use of the entire site. Along with the project, the Heath Gymnasium will be converted to forced heat and air conditioning and the flooring system will be converted to a raised wood floor.

div.font: Oak Grove School District would like all parents living in the boundaries of District #68 to pre-register their kindergarten students. Pre-registration begins Monday, February 3, 2020 and ends on Friday, March 13, 2020. To pre-register, please call the Oak Grove School office at (309) 697-0621 (between 9 am and 3 pm) or come to the Oak Grove School Office to provide the necessary information for pre-registration. For parents that pre-register within the window stated above, $10.00 will be discounted off the registration fee in August.

h2.font: Bright Futures Pick UP @ Door 7 Effective 10/15/2019

div.font: Due to the construction taking place in the rear of the building, it is necessary to move our lunch recesses to the front of the building. This requires that pick up for the Bright Futures classroom will be at Door 7 until further notice. Please use the last entrance, pull all the way around the lot and wait for pick up at Door 7. We apologize for any inconvenience and ask for your patience as we continue to improve our building and site for our students and staff. Thank you...OG Administration.

h2.font: Click Here to sign up for the 2019-20 Concessions stand help for Oak Grove School. We appreciate parent partnerships and helping provide concessions that ultimately help our student athletes with the money raised. Please consider volunteering your time by signing up for concessions.

td.h2: 2019 - Drop Off & Pick Up Procedures - Please Read

h2.font:
Please read the procedures as there are changes for the 2019-20 school year. Thank you for your patience and cooperation with our drop-off and pick-up. The doors have been renumbered for safety standard protocol so the drop off door is now number 7 and the pick up door is now door 12. These are the same locations as previous years. Parents are not to use the front circle drive for normal drop-off or pick-up. Only use the circle drive during the school day and check into the office first through door number 1.
2019-20 Drop-off & Pick-up Procedures - Download or View Here

We are excited to see all of our students back from summer break! It's time to move up a grade and do your best in the new year. Any new students that missed on-site registration can download packets at the registration page and contact the main office to make an appointment. Residency will be checked prior to registration of students. Please call the office with any questions.

td.div:
This year we are developing our video team at Oak Grove. Students are excited about utilizing technology to record and edit our school programs. In case you have missed it...here are some programs that are up and available for you to watch, just search OG68TV on YouTube!
Grandparent's Day - Kindergarten
Elementary Monster Mash - Halloween
2017 Veteran's Day Program
2017 K-2 Christmas Concert
2017 5th - 8th Christmas Concert In the future our students, staff, and administration will be making commercials, student behavior videos, and other fun videos that will be placed on the channel. If you love Oak Grove, subscribe to the channel and be ready to enjoy all of the latest videos!

Are you a Twitter user? If so follow us by clicking the link above. Also, if you want to see all of the great things that are happening at Oak Grove School - search #OG68SOARS on Twitter. You will be amazed at the awesome creativity taking place in our school!

div.font: In support of Peoria County businesses, we would like you to consider buying from stores in Peoria County. Not only can you get your items right away, you also help Peoria County Schools through the County Facilities Sales Tax! From Black Friday to Cyber Monday and all of your shopping needs...please consider supporting local businesses!

span.font: The mission of Oak Grove Schools is to provide an opportunity for every student to master grade level skills regardless of previous academic performance, family background, socioeconomic status, race, or gender. We will measure our achievement based on local and state assessments and overall classroom performance. The entire staff pledges to ensure student success by providing a positive learning environment that meets the needs of every child.

h2.font: Congratulations to Khia and Ms. Sego for their recent awards! Click on the picture for more information.

td.h2: Open Studio - Come join us at 7:45 on Wednesday mornings!

span.font: Studio 68 exists to provide a collaborative work space for making, learning, exploring, sharing and doing. This can be done with the use of high tech or no tech tools. We have created this space for our students and have a variety of maker equipment including 3D printers, dye sublimation, stem activities and a green screen video studio.

Open Studio is not necessarily a club, but an opportunity for students to learn how to use the studio when making their own projects. Dr. Baele and Mr. Lindsay will provide guidance and assistance as students plan, build, and showcase their work. Most materials will be provided, but students may be expected to purchase some items to fit the needs of their project.

Open Studios will be held on Wednesdays before school at 7:45 until morning assembly for students 5th through 8th grade. Students are not required to make every meeting but it is encouraged. Watch for more information on our Facebook page and the Oak Grove website. Our first meeting will be on October 23rd at 7:45.

td.h2: Immediate Need For Substitutes - Oak Grove Needs You!
td.div: Substitutes Needed! The Oak Grove School District needs your help. If you are a certified substitute or are a retired teacher looking for some extra money, please consider subbing at Oak Grove School. Are you a paraprofessional? We also need substitutes to cover our paraprofessional absences. Please call 309.697.3367 for more information about joining the Oak Grove team as a substitute teacher or substitute paraprofessional.

Oak Grove School District #68
6018 W. Lancaster Rd.
Bartonville, IL 61607

Comments or Questions on the Website - please email me.
lbaele@og68.org
